appleName: Flag of the Turks & Caicos Islands

components.description: The letter T, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter T

components.description: The letter C, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter C

description: The flag for Turks & Caicos Islands, which may show as the letters T and C on some platforms.
title: Flag: Turks & Caicos Islands

emoji_net_data.definition: The Flag for Turks & Caicos Islands emoji is a sequence of the ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­ter T and ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­t http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-turks-caicos-islands/
emoji_net_data.name: Turks & Caicos Islands

bn:13778626a: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).

bn:01158097n: The flag of the Turks and Caicos Islands is similar to the flags of other British dependencies and colonies as it has the Union Flag in the canton.

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:02376415n: A British overseas territory in the Caribbean. Official name: Turks and Caicos Islands (TCI).
A British overseas territory in the Caribbean.

The Turks and Caicos Islands, or TCI for short, are a British Overseas Territory consisting of the larger Caicos Islands and smaller Turks Islands, two groups of tropical islands in the Lucayan Archipelago, part of the larger Antilles island grouping.
Two groups of islands in the Caribbean located north of Haiti and east of Cuba that are a British Overseas Territory. The capital is Cockburn Town, located on Grand Turk Island.

bn:00047612n: Sub-continental land that is surrounded by water
An island or isle is any piece of sub-continental land that is surrounded by water.
A land mass (smaller than a continent) that is surrounded by water
Area of land completely surrounded by water.
Islands are sub-continental landforms that are surrounded by water.
A land mass, especially one smaller than a continent, entirely surrounded by water.
A contiguous area of land, smaller than a continent, totally surrounded by water.

bn:00023236n: The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the flag of the Turks and Caicos Islands emoji proudly displays its recognizable design with vibrant colors and crisp detail, a testament to Apple's commitment to accurate iconography. The Union Jack in the canton is rendered with subtle depth, while the emblem is clear and well-defined, all presented with the smooth gradients and soft rounded edges characteristic of Apple's visual style. This emoji is ideal for indicating location, national pride, or travel to this specific Caribbean archipelago.
